rhispm wrote:
>> From what I could tell, there didn't seem to 
>> be anything problematic, but the use of the 'most-favored' robots
> policy 
>> and the 1GB max-size-bytes for ARCs are less commonly-used options. It 
>> would be worth a try to set both these back to the defaults to see if 
>> the OOME goes away.
> 
> I did that and the OOME did not reappear. I cannot say which of the
> two options was the cause (since I turned them both back to default at
> once) but now the crawler is still up and running for > 48hrs. So I'd
> consider this issue to be "fixed". If you want me to find out wich of
> the above mentioned options was the cause, let me know and I'll do the
> two required "experiments".

Glad to hear the problem cleared up. I would like to know if only one of 
the changes is enough to trigger the OOME -- there must be a bug here 
somewhere. But if the workaround of accepting defaults avoids the 
problem for you, it's not urgent.... whenever you get the chance.

(The large max-size would make more sense, but ARC-writing isn't 
supposed to be buffering the full ARC in RAM, nor should it be using 
memory-mapped files that might exhaust addressable memory on a 32bit 
machine. So there's still a mystery.)


> thank you for your help 
> cheers

You're welcome!

- Gordon @ IA
